name: Eventful
tag_list: social, search, local, events, demand, activities, performers, ottawa
overview:
Eventful is search site that allows people to find, catalog, share and demand events, that was launched September 23, 2005 and is based out of San Diego, CA. The service allows its users to find, promote, share and create events. Brian Dear, a veteran of eBay and mp3.com, founded it in January 2004. Eventful has raised both Series A, B, and C rounds of financing.

Eventful has over 6 million event listings worldwide. In June 2007, they received a CNET “Webware 100” award for entertainment. Eventful competitors include Upcoming.org and Zvents.

funding_rounds.source_description: Eventful nabs a strategic investment and Ticketmaster partnership

milestones.description:
Eventful community surpasses 10 million registered users and 75,000
performers
milestones.source_text:
SAN DIEGO, CA - June 21, 2009 - Eventful <http://eventful.com/> , the
leading digital media service for discovering and promoting local events,
today announced that its community has surpassed ten million registered
users.  The company also announced that over 75,000 performers use
Eventful's unique 'Demand it!' service to determine where to perform based
upon consumer demand for events.  With the largest user community and most
comprehensive event selection, Eventful has emerged as the clear leader in
the local events space.



Eventful helps its users discover what's happening in local markets
throughout the world, with community members from over 200 countries.  The
service provides the world's most comprehensive local event selection with
over 4 million to choose from across all categories from concerts and live
music, sports and kids' activities to cooking classes and art gallery
openings.  



Users enjoy multiple channels for discovering events including online at
www.eventful.com <http://www.eventful.com/> , by email through individually
tailored event guides, and through mobile applications for the iPhone and
other platforms.  Eventful's 'Artist Tracker' enables users to easily import
performers from services such as iTunes and Last.fm and receive online,
email and iPhone notifications when their favorites are coming to town.
Eventful also broadly distributes event content via widgets and applications
throughout the web, including Eventful's leading 'My Top Artists' event
application in MySpace.  



Eventful's community of ten million users connect with each other through
online and mobile social networking features to meet and communicate with
other local users with shared interests around events and entertainment.
The service enables users to easily share favorite events, form groups and
keep track of the events which their friends plan to attend.



In addition to providing services to its own user community, Eventful is the
leading technology platform provider enabling a digital ecosystem for local
events. Over 2,000 partners license Eventful's API platform and local event
content to power event calendars within their own websites, mobile
applications and digital signage offerings.  In addition, dozens of leading
brands work with Eventful to reach its large audience of young, active,
entertainment-oriented consumers.



Eventful's unique Demand it! service empowers fans to influence where their
favorite performers appear.  Over 75,000 performers use the social media
service and resulting data to make decisions regarding where to route their
tours based upon where fans 'Demand' them.  Demand it! fills a critical need
within the transforming landscape of the music industry in which musicians
and their management have come to rely more heavily on revenues from live
events.  Eventful helps decision-makers generate essential data regarding
where to tour and enables them to promote the resulting events via
geographically targeted emails to their fans in local markets.



Demand it! is used by performers across segments from musicians and
politicians to comedians, film-makers and authors.  The list includes KISS,
Madonna, Keith Urban, Paramore, Rascal Flatts, Barack Obama and many more.
During the campaigns leading up to the 2008 election, virtually all of the
presidential candidates from both parties used Demand it! to engage
supporters and determine where to go on the campaign trail.  Along with
MySpace, Facebook and YouTube, Eventful has become an essential component of
the digital marketing toolkit for musicians, politicians and other
performers.



"We're really enthusiastic about our relationship with Eventful, a quickly
expanding, dynamic web service which enables fans to better discover, share
and demand all sorts of various local events," said Eric Korman, President
of Ticketmaster.  "The company has a fantastic, entrepreneurial management
team."



"Eventful has become an indispensable tool for our artists to promote their
events, engage with their fans and create marketing initiative around live
performances," said Syd Schwartz, SVP of Digital Strategy at EMI Records.
"Eventful's Demand it! service is a crucial part of our digital marketing
strategy for both leading and emerging artists."



"We're dedicated to helping our users live more fulfilling lives by
discovering and enjoying events in their communities and travel
destinations," said Jordan Glazier, Eventful's CEO.  "Thanks to our
incredibly talented team, loyal users and strategic partners, we've been
able to reach an important milestone in the growth of our business."
